meanings.definition: Relating to or produced by an oscillograph.
meanings.sent1: The oscillographic display showed the changing patterns of the waves.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used an oscillographic tool to study the electrical signals.
meanings.sent3: The oscillographic patterns on the screen looked like dancing lines.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an oscillographic chart, constantly recording new thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The oscillographic image was so clear, it felt like seeing sound waves.

meanings.definition: A device that produces a visual representation of oscillations or waveforms.
meanings.sent1: The oscillographic helped the technician analyze the electrical signals.
meanings.sent2: I used the oscillographic to see the wave patterns in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The oscillographic beeped happily as it displayed the data.
meanings.sent4: The oscillographic was like a magic mirror reflecting the invisible waves.
meanings.sent5: The oscillographic hummed softly, creating a mesmerizing display of waves.
